hey folks: since upgrading to 10.10, my box isn't accepting incoming web traffic anymore
oh. i was thinking you were running a web server ;)
it was running, but stopping it didnt help :(
this will tell you if your web server is listening on port 443:  `netstat -tap | grep https`
this will tell you if your web server is listening on port 80:  `netstat -tap | grep http`
thanks - it is listening, as is the lighthttp on 8080
can you connect to your web server locally?  `lynx http://localhost`
yes - that was one of my first troubleshooting steps...gotta love lynx
well `sudo iptables -L` will list any host based firewalls you may have that may be blocking inbound traffic
thanks - I'm better with ps, don't really know my way around iptables
also check your apache log files as well as /var/log/syslog after restarting the Apache service to see if an error pops up on service start
well `sudo /etc/init.d/iptables stop` will stop any host based firewall rules if you do have any
`sudo apparmor_status` will allow you to view the current status of AppArmor profiles
so netstat tells us that apache is listening on :80. lynx tells us that we can connect to apache locally. so apache is in fact alive and kicking.
you may have to actually do the following  to completely disable apparmor until reboot: `sudo /etc/init.d/apparmor stop; sudo update-rc.d -f apparmor remove`
